channel.title: Fictional Extraterrestrial Species on Alien Truth Social
channel.description: Recent content in Fictional Extraterrestrial Species on Alien Truth Social

item.title: Lists of fictional extraterrestrials
item.description:
Lists of Fictional Extraterrestrial Species ðŸ”—

This page serves as a central index for various lists of fictional extraterrestrial species found in different media. It helps users navigate to specific lists based on their interests.

Alphabetical ðŸ”—

This section provides a comprehensive alphabetical listing of fictional alien species. Each letter links to a dedicated page containing a list of alien species whose names begin with that letter. This allows for easy browsing if you know the name of the species or want to explore species alphabetically.

By Medium & Franchise ðŸ”—

This section organizes lists of fictional extraterrestrial species by the medium in which they appear (literature, comics, film, television, games) and the specific franchise they belong to.

Literature ðŸ”—

  • List of Noon Universe alien races: This links to the “Races” section within the Noon Universe article, detailing the various alien races featured in the Noon Universe series of science fiction books.

Comics ðŸ”—

  • List of alien races in DC Comics: This links to a comprehensive list of alien races that appear in publications by DC Comics, including well-known species from Superman, Green Lantern, and other titles.
  • List of alien races in Marvel Comics: This links to a comprehensive list of alien races that appear in publications by Marvel Comics, including species from Guardians of the Galaxy, X-Men, and other titles.

Film and Television ðŸ”—

  • List of Doctor Who universe creatures and aliens: This links to a list of creatures and aliens from the Doctor Who universe, a long-running British science fiction television program.
  • List of Star Trek aliens: This links to a list of alien species featured in the Star Trek franchise, including the Vulcans, Klingons, Romulans, and many others.
  • List of Star Wars creatures: This links to a list of creatures from the Star Wars universe.
  • Lists of Star Wars species: This section breaks down the Star Wars species lists into alphabetical segments:
    • Aâ€“E
    • Fâ€“J
    • Kâ€“O
    • Pâ€“T
    • Uâ€“Z
  • Species of the Marvel Cinematic Universe: This links to a list of species featured in the Marvel Cinematic Universe films and television series.

Games ðŸ”—

  • Battlelords of the 23rd Century#Races: This links to the “Races” section within the Battlelords of the 23rd Century article, detailing the various alien races featured in the tabletop role-playing game.
  • Races of Mass Effect: This links to a list of alien races featured in the Mass Effect video game series, such as the Asari, Turians, and Krogans.
  • Races of StarCraft: This links to a list of alien races featured in the StarCraft video game series, such as the Zerg and Protoss.

By Appearance ðŸ”—

This section categorizes lists of fictional extraterrestrial species based on their general appearance.

  • List of humanoid aliens: This links to a list of alien species that resemble humans in their basic body plan.
  • List of reptilian humanoids: This links to a list of alien species that have reptilian features and a humanoid body plan.

See also ðŸ”—

This section provides a table linking to other lists of fictional life forms, organized by type (plants, animals, humanoids, etc.) and further subdivided by specific categories (e.g., lists of fictional dogs, cats, birds, reptiles). It also includes links to lists of legendary creatures, theological beings, and related topics like fictional technology and themes in science fiction.

source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lists_of_fictional_extraterrestrials
